<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Sylph](/Monsters.aspx?ID=762)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Born with elemental gales coursing through their breath, sylphs are wispy planar scions whose bodies seem caught in a perpetual, gentle breeze. Born of unions between mortals and [djinn](/Monsters.aspx?ID=212), sylphs are quick-witted and creative, but they are prone to flights of fancy and tend to be easily distracted.

 Sylphs are notorious for their practice of “listening to the wind,” which most others dismiss as a fancy name for eavesdropping. Yet this custom means much more to sylphs, who spend hours listening to the stories brought to them on the proverbial breeze. While some less scrupulous sylphs may use the information they learn to blackmail or abuse others, most of them see listening to the wind as their way of staying connected to the world around them while still keeping it comfortably at arm's length. Certainly the typical sylph sneak doesn't seek to use what they learn for ill, but instead tries to warn others of dangers yet unrealized or to prepare themself for a dangerous task.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10
</column>

</column>

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Sylph Sneak](/Monsters.aspx?ID=762)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CG" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
<trait label="Sylph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=311" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 202 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +5

**Languages**
[Auran](/Languages.aspx?ID=15), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +7, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +6, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +6, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +4, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +7, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +1

**Wis** +0

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Items**
[Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Starknife](/Weapons.aspx?ID=44)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 

**Fort** +4 

**Ref** +9 

**Will** +8 

</row>

**HP** 17

**Deflecting Gale** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Trigger** The sylph sneak is the target of a physical ranged attack; **Requirements** The sylph sneak is aware of the attack; **Effect** A swift gale whips up between the sylph sneak and the source of the ranged attack, giving the sneak a +3 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
starknife +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+4

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
starknife +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [thrown 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+1

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The sylph sneak's Strikes deal 1d6 extra precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures.

**Surprise Attacker**    On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to the sylph sneak.

**Wind's Guidance**    When the sylph sneak attacks with a [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon, the range increment increases by 10 feet.

</column>
